meanings.definition: Consisting of or characterized by three stones or pillars.
meanings.sent1: The ancient structure featured a trilithic entrance made of three massive stones.
meanings.sent2: The trilithic monument stood proudly in the center of the village.
meanings.sent3: The trilithic design of the garden gate made it look like a magical portal.
meanings.sent4: Her trilithic necklace symbolized the strong bond between her, her mother, and her grandmother.
meanings.sent5: The trilithic formation in the canyon was a breathtaking sight to behold.

meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling a trilithon.
meanings.sent1: The artist created a trilithic sculpture that mimicked the ancient stone structures.
meanings.sent2: The trilithic patterns on the wall added a touch of history to the room.
meanings.sent3: The trilithic painting seemed to come alive with its intricate details.
meanings.sent4: His trilithic artwork captured the essence of ancient architecture in a modern way.
meanings.sent5: The trilithic carvings on the temple walls told stories of the past.

meanings.definition: Constructed with three stones or pillars.
meanings.sent1: The trilithic bridge spanned the river, connecting the two banks seamlessly.
meanings.sent2: The trilithic structure was a marvel of engineering in its simplicity.
meanings.sent3: The trilithic fountain in the park sprayed water from its three stone spouts.
meanings.sent4: The trilithic altar was where the ancient rituals were performed under the open sky.
meanings.sent5: The trilithic staircase led to a hidden chamber beneath the castle.
